Good granola, fresh fruit, and, delicious acai.
It's my second favorite Acai place in SF (first is Blue Hawaii!)
There was no line when I went, and the people working were very nice.

I suggest buying a large; it's over twice as big as the small and just a few bucks more. You might want to share it though cuz its HUGE.
author: Regina M.

description: Yummy bowl but a small is $11. I though the smoothie could have been more flavorful, but the granola and cacao nibs were yummy.
author: Melissa G.

description:
I was super dehydrated and famished after not eating all day and working out a lot (bad combo, I know). I was craving a smoothie, yet wanted Acai, and what do you know? Basik has both! It was so delicious: natural, naturally sweet, perfect size, and it filled me up the right amount. They didn't have apple juice or mango juice when I went in, as the smoothie normally does, but they offered almond milk and it was so good. 
I will definitely be back, and next time I'll try the Acai bowl to see how it is, though in sure it'll be just as good, if not better.
author: Shira S.

description: Basik has the best acai bowl in the entire city. And they have the long lines to prove it. So if you're going on the weekend, get there early when they open or expect to wait about a half an hour in line. They have great quality ingredients and a huge variety of bowls and add-ons. Definitely very filling. My ONLY complaint is how expensive their bowls can be ($11 for a small!), especially with their add-ons. This makes it tough to want to get a bowl after every workout.
author: Aryn V.

description: I'm in love with their acai bowls! I've tried other places in downtown, but this place is probably by far the best one. A small acai bowl is $11 and a large will cost you $14. They also have smoothies if you're not feeling in the mood for an acai bowl.
author: Sandy C.

description:
I absolutely love this place and can't recomend highly enough. Hands down the best smoothies and acai bowls. There is a place in Santa Barbara that I love to go to, and I never thought I'd find anything like that here. Well, this place is way better! 

I love the serene atmosphere. I just feel happy sitting in there. I'm slowly working my way through the menu (faves so far-the Patriots super bowl even though they're my 2nd least favorite nfl team, and the banyan; fave smoothi, the kona). Everything tastes fresh-not refrigerator like some nearby cafes. Everything tastes & is presented with care, and the ingredients taste like quality, fresh ingredients. And, the staff are nice, down to earth, and the place is spotless. 

I'm headed there right now for the embarrassingly 4th time in 7 days...i would honestly eat this everyday. Actually, I'm sure that i will be a daily regular from now on,
author: Nic Z.

description: By far the best acai I have had in the city! The line to order is a little slow but the waiting for your order is fairly quick. Parking was easy to find on the block and would definitely recommend to all of those who like acai! The only thing that confuses me is that the large size is so much bigger than the small size and is only a few bucks more but then again no one can probably finish the large on their own...
author: Vonny C.

description:
Bold Italic ranked Basik as the place to go for açai so I couldn't resist! Situated on the more north side of Polk, this little shop offers fresh ingredients and nutritious meals. Açai bowls come in small and large and range from$8-$14.

I got the puna and was super excited that it was berry heavy, I only wish I had more granola haha! But  I loved how I was able to take my little bowl over to Lafayette park to enjoy my bowl and sunshine!
author: Christina C.

description: It was hard for me to give this a rating since I have one incident that will always stick out. Yes I do love this place. I always get the Brasilian. It's quite yummy. Now for the incident that tainting this review .... I had ordered my food to go one day. I got home and starting eating my food and realized here was a hair in it. I just didn't have the time or energy to go back. So the next time I went, I had mentioned it and the guy at the counter didn't seem to take me seriously and joked about how it's suppose to be in there. I brushed it off and yet I still got something and come back. Now I just eat there just in case. Yes that's not good but I really like their acai bowls.
author: Cynthia L.

description: Epic Acai bowls, and smoothies! So happy this place is open. One of the few places in SF that you can get quality acai. This is a must try!
author: Kris H.

description: One of my favorite new places! Amazing I love the Puna & Forager bowls!! Staff is super friendly..weekends this place is packed but worth the wait.
author: Kelly T.

description:
Been here twice now, both on saturday mornings. Staff is friendly, once you order the bowl is made relatively quickly.

One saturday we got there at 9:30 and there was next to no line. The other saturday we went around 11 and there was a line around the corner! 

The banyan bowl is great, healthy acai with a little peanut butter and banana taste. Was perfect the 1st time i got it. The second time - i think they forgot to put the peanut butter in the blend :( not as good but still tasty.

Overall - definitely recommend!
author: Doug H.

description:
Truthfully, I've never had an acai bowl or acai smoothie before. I would pass by this place during our weekend walks, and it's always packed. I saw someone walking out of the cafe holding a large bowl of acai with fresh fruits, and I thought to myself, "what is this thing that so many people seem to love?"

I was intrigued and finally tried it. Basik's acai bowl is SO GOOD!!!  I get the Brazilian bowl with strawberries, granola and honey. It's so simple, but so delicious (not to mention pretty nutritious). 

I stood in line for 30 minutes once just to get my fix. Trust me, it's that good!
author: Khristine A.

description: Ok so it's kind of overpriced...but there's a line out the door a reason. Plus if you get the large it's a solid amount that's pretty satisfying. Can't beat the almond mylk and all the fresh natural ingredients. Nothing about this place screams chain and I like that! Great addition to the neighborhood!
author: Ada K.

description:
Great ingredients! Highly recommend coming here. 

Like Jamba Juice though, there are healthy and not so healthy. So I recommend going with good intentions and live to your hearts content (either way it's still healthy right?)
author: Richard W.

description: I am a huge fan of acai bowls! I was in the neighborhood and decided to try Basik Cafe. Surprisingly, parking was relatively easy to find. They have a good selection of both bowls and smoothies, and if there is anything you want to switch out, they happily take care of it. I got the Waialea smoothie and the puna bowl. Both were delicious and good portion sizes. However, giving four stars because it's a bit pricy  ($18 for a small smoothie and small bowl) and they did not have orange juice to substitute for the Apple juice in the smoothie, which I would have preferred. Overall, great place and experience, can't wait to try the rest of the menu!
author: Mary S.

description: I got the Puna and my husband got the Islander. Gorgeous presentation of fresh fruit and granola, and it tastes as good as it looks. Made for a great breakfast since bowls are rather large and quite filling. I look forward to coming back and trying the other flavors and smoothies.
author: Riz W.

description: I'll keep this simple. Puna Bowl. Amazing. Smoothies are good but this place offers really fresh and healthy Acai bowls for a cough complete ripoff cough but it's worth it in moderation. So delicious!
author: Derek S.

description: Great place for smoothie, breakfast or healthy afternoon snack! I will suggest to come with a friend where you can share the large size order with cause even the Acai bowl is amazing and the ingredients are great the price for their item are a bit on the higher side .... However, it's still a great neighborhood found which I will for sure stop often and I believe all their items on their menu are non-dairy, plant-based, super duper great for you superfood!
author: Eric W.

description:
Bomb bomb bomb bomb bomb! This place is bomb and everyone knows it.. The line was long and I bet it usually is!! The bowl that I got was amazing, it had all kinds of nuts and bird seed looking stuff on it and it all worked in perfect harmony!! The guy who helped us (long brown hair!) was very nice and recommended the peanut butter acaci bowl to me!! Great decision and I would get it again!
Kinda expensive, but u pay for quality in my opinion
author: Andrew S.

description: I've tried numerous acai bowls in New York City and even Hawaii and this is the best I've had. The major difference is the consistency of the acai blend. Whereas most are too watery or flavorless, this one holds up like a Wendy's frostee and has the right amount of tanginess. Also, the fruit toppings are always ripe. It's not cheap and lines can be long but it's a great post-workout treat.
author: Steve N.

description:
Loved the Acai Bowls here! 

I had a large for $14 dollars and it was worth it. Will definitely be coming back the next time I'm in SF. There was a line when I got there and I had to wait around ten minutes to order, but I was greeted and the service was so friendly I had to overlook it.
author: Obinna A.

description: When I went, there was no wait. I got the "islander" and loved the combo of everything in it (the granola was nicely placed into the middle of the acai bowl instead of on top which I really liked). It was very refreshing and would be good to have after a workout. Personally, I think that it is a bit too pricey ($11 for the Islander); however, they give you a good portion, especially if you get the large size. It would definitely be a good meal substitute :)
author: Grace Z.

description:
So expensive...

But then again i guess this is san francisco and if you really wanted to you could go down the street to get a $15 salad to chase down your $14 acai.
author: Alex K.

description: Delicious acai bowl for a healthy take on brunch! It'd be 5 stars if the price was a little lower.
author: Erin W.

description: OOOOKKK. This place is good but no better than my go-to's which are Judahlicious and Plant Cafe. Along with that, you get half the amount for the price of the ones at their competitors. My "Puna" bowl was yummy but I would have got double amount for my small elsewhere for the same price. I have been trying to come here many a Saturday's but have kept driving past since the lines are insane all day on the weekends. Luckily I had some time on Friday afternoon to try it out (where only a few people were there), and the bowl was great. Although good, I'll keep going to my regular places and will probably rarely fancy this place.
author: Alexis T.

description: Yum!! Love this place! Always a line here which is a good sign and they are fast too!! Portions are large which is always good & filling!!
author: Sinead M.

description:
The line is long. So, expect a wait. It's a one man show taking orders and bringing orders out to waiting customers, which really slows things down.

As far as the acai bowls, they are good. Very refreshing, healthy and full of fruit. Vitality bowl downtown tastes better to me but it could be because of the bowl I ordered.
author: Amy L.

description: LOVE the acai bowl! Beware, there will be a long line out the door. Just goes to show you how good they are!
author: Clay P.

description:
Good Acai bowl (wish I could pronounce it) with granola and banana and strawberry.
Best since Hawaii. 
Staff is very nice and helpful.
author: Katie F.

description: Basik cafe is an awesome new addition to the neighborhood! The bowls are perfectly sized and so delicious. The service is good - it's been super crowded but I haven't had to wait very long for my order. Some reviews mentioned it's expensive; it's worth every penny. I look forward to coming here a lot.
author: Monika F.

description: Went back today and had the patriots super bowl. Har har har. Rasperries and coconut shavings oh yes please
author: Michelle A.

description:
I'm visiting San Francisco from Seattle and this is the first acai bowl I've ever had. To be honest, I'd never even heard of such a thing before. Wow. It was delish! I got the PUNA bowl for a late afternoon lunch. Light and tasty for a sunny day in SF.

Highly recommended. If you are hungry you might need to get the large or just get this as an app before a more hearty meal. But great for a light lunch!
author: Bridget M.

description: Best acai bowl I have ever had!! Super fresh ingredients and great menu for different bowl and smoothie options. Staff was really friendly and positive, they made it super easy to customize the perfect bowl. :)
author: Kasey R.

description: I was dying to try an acai bowl and a friend recommended Basik! What a great rec. The smoothie bowl was so fresh, so delicious, and filling. I got a small and cannot fathom eating the large. A once a week visit to Basik is definitely going to work its way into my routine. Yumm...
author: Kelsey K.

description: The price is a bit steep but you're paying for quality. Fast, clean, and delicious acai bowls! Make sure you get the BANYAN if you're a fan of peanut buttah. It's the best seller at the original location as well
author: Jenny W.

description: Heaven!!! I have been waiting for a great acai bowl place in the city for years. In fact we had been waiting since we went and discovered acai for the very first time in Kona. Well guess what?!?! Low and behold, it's the same chain!!!!!! What?! We saw the picture in the shop of the Basik cafe in Kona and couldn't believe it! Top notch! I have had some so so acai bowls...but something about the quality is amazing here. Worth the line. Though I don't love the Sunday hours:/. We made it a minute before 1pm though! Phew
author: Drea L.

description: Love this place. My husband and I always get one when we're getting our hair cut down the street. There's always a line and their large is big enough to share! Do it.
author: Daphne H.

description: The Brazilian bowl was great. The line may seem long but it moves quickly. Parking isn't too bad on an early Saturday morning. I hope they add a smaller size than their small. :-)
author: Crystal K.

description: While the bowls are good, they are extremely pricy (and nothing's even organic!) and the service is HORRIBLE. They are barely even open (weird hours that make no sense, change and are all over the place) and when we went this morning while it was raining, got there a few minutes early and the lazy staff would not even let us in for cover and just stood at the door and watched us standing in the rain. So rude, and extremely poor service.
author: Sarah P.

description: Really really good ! It's a bit pricey and can break the wallet but the quality is good ! Only thing is that every time I order the large from post mates they put and overwhelming amount of granola and barely any acai
author: Josie M.

description: I love this place and their acai bowls! So fresh, healthy, and delicious. I wish there were more places like this around the city!
author: Amy L.

description:
This is BOMB!!!!

Super quality ingredients! Super good tasting! 

If you want energy, and you want healthy too!

Go here!!!
author: Peter P.

description: I decided to try this today because I had time to waste and wanted to see what all the fuss was about. I always see the huge line down the street at this place. What a great yum yum! I got a large Brasilian bowl which took about 40 minutes to eat. Next time I'll split it with my little girlfriend I think! I'll also wear headphones next time because it's so hard to stand in line for 15 minutes with all the marina-girl-in-lululemon-cackling-in-questions all around...come prepared!
author: Jay S.

description: My first acai bowl ever was at Basik, and I'm obsessed now! Not only is their name funny and alluring, but inside is also very nice. I ordered the Brazilian, but as I'm not keen on bananas, I swapped those out for strawberries (which they were more than happy to do for me). The bowl kept me full for hours, I almost forgot about dinner (which NEVER happens!). I will be a customer for life, the $8 for a regular is more than enough for one person. I would consider splitting the large for $11 with one or two people depending on how hungry we all were. Overall, a wonderful experience, can't wait to go back!
author: Charlotte C.

description: The wait for this place to open has been MORE than worth it!  The staff and menu options absolutely bring the spirit of aloha to the mainland.  So glad my wife and I can just get up and walk down the street, and don't have to fly out to Hawaii anymore, when we crave acai bowls!  Superb job, Basik!
author: Phil S.

description: Love! Love! Love! Super fresh and delicious!! Wished they can open one up in Houston in the near future!
author: Tee T.

description: I'm a sucker for acai bowls, and Basik does them right. I'm a big fan of the Islander and the Banyan. Add almonds for a longer lasting crunch, and go for the bigger size. Expect to stand in line for at least 10 minutes. #worthit.
author: Audrey A.

description: Love this place! So cute and so yummy. Got the banyan and added strawberries, it was delicious
author: Cassi R.

description: Delicious and colorful acai bowls. The employees are friendly and the cafe is modern.
author: Hilary M.

description: Tipped off about this place by a friend.  Pricey! But if you get the large bowl it's good enough for two meals, which makes it reasonable.  I've ordered the Islander and the Puna bowls so far.  Next time I go, I'm going to try it with the crushed almonds rather than the granola.
author: Mary V.

description: I'm a total foodie and when I heard about acai bowls in San Francisco I had to try them. I was only in town for a short time and this place was close so I headed over for breakfast on a weekday (around 9:30). I was second in line and ended up getting the Indian Summer bowl (a bowl only available in the fall). While I was waiting for it to come out (which took about 3-4 minutes), I was getting mad at myself for not going with one of their more traditional bowls (as I had never had an acai bowl before and I figured the more traditional the better). But when I tried it, I was in heaven (and definitely not regretting it!). So good!! For me, the price was quite steep for a breakfast bowl (11$ for a small), but the small bowl was quite large and there were definitely enough toppings and granola pieces to make each bite flavorful. I would definitely recommend trying this place!
author: Annika R.

description: This place is the bomb! My hubby and I drive from Redwood City just to get their Banyan bowls on the weekends. And we are even okay to wait 20 minutes in line for it! Yup it's that good. They flavor and texture is perfection and they are very generous with their toppings. I'm so addicted to this place!!!
author: Wing L.

description: Great acai bowls but a little pricey $11 for a small, is that normal? I got the Puna and substituted hemp seeds with crushed almonds.
author: Joyce M.

description: When I lived in LA, I used to get an acai bowl almost everyday because I just cannot resist the deliciousness. Moving to SF and not having many acai bowl places near me, I was so excited to try this new acai bowl place; but I was SO disappointed when I finally did. I walked in all super stoked to try the bowls because the cafe was so cute and had a Good Vibes sign on an arrow pointing to the cafe. Although the options were limited and this place was pricey, I was still excited to try it. But when I finally got my overpriced bowl, it had no flavor, at all. On top of that, all they added to my bowl was honey, granola, and banana. If you're gonna charge me $8 for a bowl that only has honey and granola, you could at least make sure  the acai has some flavor. Beware, it doesn't. If you know your acai bowls, this place was is no good.
author: Kapri H.

description: half the time I try to go here there are people inside and the doors are locked.  Closed between 12-1pm on saturday during lunch?  What is that?  Waited in line for 10 min then they run out of acai?  Ummm Its great food but, you guys gotta work on your service.
author: Mike K.

description: I was visiting from out of town and am definitely no acai bowl expert, but this seemed like the place to be with a line out the door early on a Sunday morning.  They have two sizes for acai bowls; the small is $11 and the large is $14.  The large is almost twice the size of the small.  The staff was very accommodating and you can normally swap out a dry topping for another.  For example if you don't want hemp hearts, you might be able to swap them for shredded coconut free of charge.  All in all a great experience and my friends and I really enjoyed our bowls/smoothies.
author: Melissa N.

description: Everything tastes good here and is healthy. Won't be surprised if there is a bit of cocaine in every bowl. Feels good after and makes u crave for some more
author: Madhweep L.

description: They have no respect for food allergies.  I told them 3 times I was gluten free and they put the granola on my bowl.  Granola was hidden under all the fruit I took a large bite and now will be sick the rest of the day and maybe even tomorrow.
author: Rhonda P.

description: This place sucks they say that they stop serving at 12 which is understandable,but we waited in line for 10 min and then finally got inside and they told us that the people two in front of us were the last ones. These people should have done whoever was already inside. This is a crappy business  and I never got my acai bowl after they turned down 15 customers. Won't be back to this place EVER. I wouldn't recommend this place to anyone.
author: Paris M.

description: First time here this morning and Islander is the way to go! (Although I'm sure the others are acai-awesome) You know the place is going to have great acai bowls when it is pretty much the only thing on their menu, I went big and got the large one this morning AND met some lovely gals in line on my first official day as a San Fransican. The line goes by pretty quickly and is far easier than fighting the brunch crowd.
author: Lauren A.

description: I've been here numerous times and it just isn't consistent. I've been when the fruit was extremely fresh and I've been when they masked the middle layer of my large bowl with old bananas and strawberries...gross. The add ons are ridiculous. While I like that I can add a seasonal fruit for $1, getting 4 raspberries is just plain highway robbery. Lastly is the service, it too is very inconsistent. Most of the time, the person at the register has been nice but the last time I visited the girl behind the counter waited until I added in my tip, flipped the ipad around looked and then went and put my order together. After subbing almonds for granola and adding on $.25/piece raspberries I wasn't too inclined to tip more than a $1, sorry. That's probably why I got 2day old bananas and strawberries I suppose. Overall it is a pricey treat but some days I feel it is a treat that is just a pricey gamble.
author: Sarah M.

description: Yum, yum, yum! Today I finally came in to get an açai bowl. Boy was I blown away! I ordered the $14 large Islander bowl. It came out in less than 5 minutes. WARNING: It's quite large! Definitely coming back with my boyfriend next time.
author: Shannon R.

description: Who would think id be okay paying what I think is crazy $ for a trendy bowl of berries and nuts. But my forager bowl was really good (even though they forgot my extra $1 of blackberries, they gave me a little container with 4 blackberries when I realized the mistake) and it seemed to be made of very fresh ingredients, so I can have a nice treat and not feel too guilty.
author: Poppy C.

description: What's with all the single use products - utensils, cups, and bowls? Yeah yeah, compostable and what not but there's a lot of energy and resources that go into the production and disposal of these products. For a business that touts itself as natural and sustainable there sure is a lot of waste generated. Decent product but I hope the management rethinks its policy regarding its use of single use, disposable products.
author: Jason C.

description: I love their Acai bowls.  Lots of fresh ingredients that were made to order.  Very light breakfast that's sustaining.  The larger bowls feed two but it's so good we left wanting more.  I recommend the Islander Bowl.
author: Adam W.

description: The acai bowl with peanut butter in it is phenomenal. This place is well worth the line.
author: Shawn C.

description: Listen. This place has the BEEEEESSSTTTTTTT ACAI BOWLS OMG. If I were friends with Kanye west then I would first have a few shots of patron with him and THEN I would send him and his his 30-person posse to mess up the line at Basik.
author: Vlad A.

description: We got the puna and forager bowls. Good portions. Line was out the door. Half hour wait. Seems like a place to go after working out. Would go again though since they were pretty good. All the bowls seemed delicious.
author: Michelle C.

description: The best in SF! It's a routine every weekend, if I'm home in the city :) I would recommend to everybody. Don't let the long line fool you as it moves quickly. I have never stood in line more than 15 mins. It's worth it!
author: Jeff K.

description: I think eating the mother ship $11 (for a "small") acai bowl from this place means I've tried the best and now need to figure out how to recreate this at home for a much cheaper price.  All these people waiting in line for an hour are insane.  I went on a weekday at 8:15am, otherwise would not have bothered.
author: e w.

description: Unbelievably slow! Kept me waiting for 40 mins with just few ppl before me in the queue. Good bowls though!
author: R S.

description: If you are Brazilian, don't go with high expectations. It tastes like a good smoothie bowl, but the taste is not even close to an original Brazilian açaí. It is worth it for a healthy snack, though! :)
author: Natasha S.

description: Love me some açai bowls. The larger sizes are more economical in terms of bang for your buck, but still overpriced for the fact that it's a glorified smoothie. this won't keep me from coming but definitely not as often as I like. It's a once in a while treat for me.
author: Carly K.

description: The islander bowl and the Mayan mint are my go to. I wish there was a smaller option. I can never finish the smaller size and it's on the pricey side.
author: H K.

description: Yes please and thank you for this lil place. So good, expensive (but that's fairly normal of acai bowls) and friendly. The service is relatively quick so don't let the long line scare you. Such a healthy and refreshing add to Polk St!!
author: Casie M.

description: The best Acai bowl I've ever had.  I wanted another as soon as I finished mine.  Wish I lived closer, though if I did, it would be dangerous for me.
author: Matt A.

description: I'm visiting from Los Angeles.  Basik has the best acai bowls I've ever tasted.  There's a girl behind the counter named Ellie who is an absolute gem.  I'd give this place 100 stars if I could!!
author: John P.

description: After 3 years of living here/searching for good ace bowl places this is def the best acai bowl place in SF!!! A little pricey though
author: Page F.

description: I was so excited to try this place and ordered a bowl this morning. While waiting for my bowl we saw an employee scrape his knife on the trash after cutting bananas. Then he used a rag to wipe it off which was the same rag he used to wipe the cutting board and the side of counters. We asked if he would wash the knife and he got very defensive. He then complained and had all the employees come and stare at us like they wanted to fight us. We went up and told them why we were upset and even said we aren't try to be your boss but thats not right. The employee said, "Well, it sounds like you are". And continued to argue with us. We left very upset and uncomfortable. I tried calling the business 5 times so I could let the owner/manager know that his employee was not only a bad representation of his business but that his health score was being threatened. I thought this was a well put together place with a delicious menu but to feel so uncomfortable when we were in the right was unacceptable. I hope this business makes this right so other customers can feel safe eating there.
author: Sierra B.

description: After trying all the acai bowls in the bay area, this one ranks at the top.  The banyan is delicious.  The smaller portion was a filling size.  Good toppings to choose from.
author: around town e.

description: Very overpriced for what are essentially unblended smoothies. You add acai puree, banana, other fruit (some of which is frozen), and some additives like granola or nuts, put it in a bowl, and magically it becomes a $13 or more acai bowl.  Regardless of how healthy these bowls seem (which is debatable given the sugar level), I would not pay this much again for the sparse amount of food in them.
author: Josh Q.

description: This place sucks, I swear they think they are still in Hawaii, island time on the mainland, hurry up, with the service, people on the back working like sea turtles on land.
author: Alan P.

description: Super delicious acai bowls!  What a great addition to the 'hood
author: Yan L.

description: What a great find!   I noticed this place while taking a walk yesterday and decided to stop by to try my first acai bowl.  I am hooked!  It was delicious.  I am so happy that this is in my neighborhood :)
author: Elise C.

description: We drove from Walnut Creek, relying on Yelps info that they close at 5pm. Yelp was incorrect, they close at 4pm. Don't make our mistake, call ahead and check.
author: Ross H.

description: Trains place just opened near my house and I am hooked! The açaí bowls are delicious and filling. The staff is super friendly and knowledgable. Definitely try the Puna! It's incredible.
author: Olivia J.

description: I love San Francisco.  I usually love Nob Hill. But one horrible part of the city is the parking.  For an old lady like me parking is very important! ! I will keep shopping in the city.
author: Lucy H.

description: Uber stoked to see the same great bowls I love on the Big Island have made their way to my home in San Francisco! Welcome to my repertoire.
author: Sean D.

description: Terrible customer service. Kicked people out who were waiting in line at 11:56am on a Saturday to"let the machines cool." Guy with the red beard  thinks he's too cool and has no idea how to run a business. Don't you think if you have customers waiting in line for over 30 minutes you might as well serve the remaining 5 people in line rather than telling them tough luck leave?  Don't go here.
author: MisterSF N.

description: Wasnt able to try this place because yelp and their website have incorrect hours. Drove for 20 minutes and place was closed.
author: Nicole B.

description: AWFUL service!!!! This place won't survive after it loses its luster. At least 5 better places within a mile.
author: Shaun D.

description: For the love of SF, go here, get an acai bowl.  Freshest ingredients, tasted incredibowl.  I got a small one because the large is obnoxiously massive.  Just go here.  Whether you are hungover on a sunday morning or during work for a snack.  Amazing.
author: David P.

description: Great acai bowls with "good vibes!" Coffee is very tasty as well. Fresh and healthy breakfast with speedy service.
author: Jocelyn K.

description: I liked how you can customize your bowl. I am gluten free though so I think they should switch to a gluten free granola so I wont have to worry about contamination but the staff was really nice about explaining what I could get instead. I got the cashews instead and I wish they would chop them a little smaller to be more bite sized. I am not a big fan of sweets so I liked that I could leave off the honey and next time I may leave off the banana too. I also like the berry mixture that they use bc it is not overly sweet. Also I liked that they have cashew and almond milk bc my friend can't do almond milk. Now if they just served these bowls with a side of meat this Paleo girl would be jazzed. I want to bring my husband back here becasue I think it would be fun. I don't know if it would fill him up though so maybe it would be a fun snack. The last one I had was in Kauai and it made me feel like I was there again so that can't be bad.
author: shilo s.

description: Not convinced. A small bowl which consists half of fruit, granola and honey for $8 with an average tasting acai blend. After having tasted perfectly mixed acai before, I must say that these bowls look nice but only taste ok. Like many places in SF there is a big hype causing long lines at the weekends. Way to pricey for what it is.
author: Chris S.

description: This place is amazing! Do your self a favor and go get an açai bowl. I LOVE the banyan and the puna. I live near this place and don't think I can move because of how much I love it.
author: Valerie F.

description: Finally! We have been in need for an Acai spot here in the city for a long time. The bowls are packed with awesome superfoods and the actual Acai is a quality blend. Cool atmosphere and people that work here make this place a rad addition to the neighborhood.
author: Phillip F.

description: Having been to Basik in Kona, HI, I was thrilled to find out they opened one in SF. It's a trek to get there from the East Bay, but so worth it (and easier than flying to Kona!). I got a large acai bowl and it was a lot, but I was hungry. They were very generous with the toppings and every bite was delicious. Can't wait for my next visit.
author: Maya A.
